intro: Carduus getulus, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated, lobed leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. The plant is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
